avalancheActivity.highlights: The snowfall on Saturday will be followed by warm temperatures and rain, leading to significant snowmelt. On Sunday, temperatures will drop again, and wind slabs may form in the mountains during snow showers.

snowpackStructure.highlights: The snowfall on Saturday will be followed by warm temperatures and rain, leading to significant snowmelt. On Sunday, temperatures will drop again, and wind slabs may form in the mountains during southwesterly snow showers. The older snowpack is considered stable.

travelAdvisory.comment: Widespread snowmelt is expected across the country due to warm temperatures and rain on Saturday, with wet snow avalanches likely in the mountains. On Sunday morning, temperatures will drop again, bringing snow showers to most regions along with wind slab formation on north-facing aspects.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Widespread snowmelt is expected across the country due to warm temperatures and rain on Saturday. As temperatures drop on Sunday morning and snow showers begin, wind slab formation is expected.

weatherForecast.highlights: Aðfaranótt sunnudags er gert ráð fyrir hlýindum og rigningu upp í fjallahæð. Snemma á sunnudagsmorgun kólnar aftur með éljagangi fram á mánudag.

avalancheActivity.highlights: New wind slabs can be expected in mountains due to snowfall and snowdrift from variable southerly winds.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Snow has added and drifted in SW winds in recent days. Before, there was relatively little snow, with old stiff and stable snow in mountains.  Continuing snow showers and snowdrift from variable southerly winds are forecast the next few days. Wind slabs can be expected to form in mountains, especially in slopes with northerly aspects.

travelAdvisory.comment: Widespread snowmelt is expected across the country due to warm temperatures and rain on Saturday, with wet snow avalanches likely in the mountains. On Sunday morning, temperatures will drop again, bringing snow showers to most regions along with wind slab formation on north-facing aspects.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Widespread snowmelt is expected across the country due to warm temperatures and rain on Saturday. As temperatures drop on Sunday morning and snow showers begin, wind slab formation is expected.

weatherForecast.highlights: Talsverður éljagangur og skafrenningur úr breytilegum áttum, A-S-V. Vægt frost.

avalancheActivity.highlights: Warm temperatures on Saturday night will impact the snowpack in the lower parts of the mountains. On Sunday, wind slab formation is expected to continue in the southwest snow showers.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Warm temperatures on Saturday night will affect the snowpack in the lower parts of the mountains. On Sunday, wind slab formation is expected on north-facing slopes in southwest snow showers. The older snow is considered stable.

travelAdvisory.comment: Widespread snowmelt is expected across the country due to warm temperatures and rain on Saturday, with wet snow avalanches likely in the mountains. On Sunday morning, temperatures will drop again, bringing snow showers to most regions along with wind slab formation on north-facing aspects.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Widespread snowmelt is expected across the country due to warm temperatures and rain on Saturday. As temperatures drop on Sunday morning and snow showers begin, wind slab formation is expected.

weatherForecast.highlights: Aðfaranótt sunnudags er gert ráð fyrir skammvinnum hlýindum og rigningu  á láglendi en snjókomu í fjallahæð. Snemma á sunnudagsmorgun kólnar aftur með éljagangi fram á mánudag. Á mánudagskvöld er útlit fyrir mikla snjókomu á svæðinu.

travelAdvisory.comment: Widespread snowmelt is expected across the country due to warm temperatures and rain on Saturday, with wet snow avalanches likely in the mountains. On Sunday morning, temperatures will drop again, bringing snow showers to most regions along with wind slab formation on north-facing aspects.
travelAdvisory.highlights: Widespread snowmelt is expected across the country due to warm temperatures and rain on Saturday. As temperatures drop on Sunday morning and snow showers begin, wind slab formation is expected.
